subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Experiment 3 - Results!
author: Zack Widup
full_text:
We did that on another group I'm on. We did about 20 tests for "remote
viewing" and several people got the correct answers in a much higher
probability than expected.

And it was fun!

Zack

On Wed, Aug 4, 2010 at 4:07 PM, harpo103 <rmc103@...> wrote:

>
>
> Thats a REALY small sample size.
> You would likely need several dozen experimenters to get any solid results.
> But, nice try anyway.
>
>
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>, "rasterer"
> <rasterer@...> wrote:
> >
> >
>  > Thanks to everyone who participated in Experiment 3.
> >
> > On Friday, 7/30/2010 I placed an object on top of my computer monitor,
> right in front of me, and left it there until noon Denver time on Monday,
> 8/2/2010. This experiment asked for participants to determine what that
> object was. Vague or partial answers won't be counted (for example, just
> giving a color, shape, size, what it's made of, etc): we're looking for what
> it is. Answers anyone reveals after noon Denver time Monday won't count.
> Participants could use their ghost boxes, EVP recorders, or any other means
> they chose.
> >
> > In order to keep me honest, I took a picture of the object at the start
> of the experiment and loaded it to the Files section (RJ folder) of this
> group. The idea with this file is that you could download it at the
> beginning of the experiment and 'keep it safe' on your computer. Then at the
> end of the experiment, I would post the password so you could reveal the
> contents of the file. That way, you were in control of the original image
> during the entire time, not me.
> >
> > Passworded pdf:
> http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/EVP-ITC/files/RJ/RJ20100730.pdf
> >
> > The password for that file is: 867530Nieine
> >
> > So to the results:
> >
> > Number of participants: 2
> > Total tries: 3
> > Ambiguous answers: 0
> > Correct answers: 0
> >
> > Object: A Pot
> > Object picture:
> http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/EVP-ITC/files/RJ/RJ20100730.jpg
> >
> >
> > If anyone has any observations, comments, or ideas for improvement, let
> me know. Again, thanks to everyone who participated in this experiment.
> >
>
>  
>

We did ha on ano he g oup I'm on. We did abou 20 es s o " emo e iewing" and se e al people go he co ec answe s in a much highe p obabili y han expec ed.
 
And i was  un!
 
Zack
